answers.answer: Me at 22 weeks. Feet were so swollen and hurt last night. My MIL thinks it was either my socks being tight or walking too much. Freaked me out completely on how quick it hurt and swelled
Not that its anything but you need to let you midwife know at your next appointment
Now youre making me nervous Chellfaye23 hah

I just noticed my left foot was a little on the swollen side today I have an appt on Thurs and ill def bring it up since I'm always cautious about high blood pressure. (I tend to eat a lot of sodium) and I know swollen feet/hands/face are a sign of preeclampsia! I'm 28 weeks. Hope its nothing for you tho!! Lots of my friends swelled up and had no complications:)
i tell my hubs look at my feet is swollen and he is like i dont see a diference .. but i fell it and it hurts haha ..and my hands
I'm so sorry I didn't mean to scare you!! I should've been more considerate. All I mean is my midwife told me from day 1 not to hesitate to tell her anything swelling pain whatever.
And if you are swelling bad maybe ease up on salt intake.
It could be blood pressure.But also vericose veins do you see any?They feel like pins and needles and make you swell.

From working 8 hours and being on my feet all night I had a few bouts of swelling really bad and that was at 19 weeks... lol I just lay with my feet up and put ice packs underneath my ankles and it helped a lot!
I think I started swelling at around 25-27 weeks and I didn't really notice until I tried getting my shoes on and I suddenly had cankles lol.

question: im 25+1 weeks and the swelling is starting on my hands and feet it doesnt go crazy buy its there and it burns and feels like pins and needles .. , i dont remember how early i started swelling with my other ones ... anybody else having this so early on ??
title: swelling already ??
